name: Classic French Ratatouille
description: Hearty vegetable stew featuring eggplant, zucchini, and bell peppers in a tomato base, seasoned with Herbes de Provence.
cooking_instructions:
Prepare vegetables by slicing them into uniform pieces.
Sauté each type separately in olive oil until tender.
Layer the vegetables in a pot, then cover with herbed tomato sauce.
Simmer gently with the pot covered, stirring occasionally.
Cook until everything is tender.
Serve the ratatouille warm, with bread or as a side.

name: Indian Butter Chicken
description: Creamy tomato-based curry cooked with marinated grilled chicken, enriched with butter and cream, flavored with garam masala.
cooking_instructions:
Marinate chicken in yogurt and spices, then grill until charred.
Sauté onions, garlic, ginger, and spices in ghee until golden.
Add tomato puree to the spices and simmer into a thick gravy.
Introduce the grilled chicken to the sauce, then stir in cream.
Cook until the curry is rich and flavorful.
Serve hot, garnished with cilantro, with naan or rice.

name: Mexican Tacos al Pastor
description: Pork shoulder marinated in a blend of chilies, spices, and pineapple, then roasted and served on corn tortillas with cilantro and onions.
cooking_instructions:
Slice pork thinly and marinate in a blend of chilies, spices, and pineapple.
Grill the marinated pork until charred and tender.
Warm corn tortillas on the grill for a slight crisp.
Assemble tacos with pork, diced onion, cilantro, and a squeeze of lime.
Serve with a side of spicy salsa for an added kick.

name: Classic Margherita Pizza
description: A simple yet classic Italian pizza with a crisp crust, tangy tomato sauce, fresh mozzarella, and basil leaves.
cooking_instructions:
Spread a thin layer of homemade tomato sauce onto rolled-out pizza dough.
Sprinkle with fresh mozzarella and basil leaves.
Drizzle with olive oil and season with salt and pepper.
Bake in a preheated oven at the highest temperature until the crust is golden and cheese bubbles.
Slice and serve hot, with a drizzle of extra virgin olive oil, if desired.

name: Beef Bourguignon
description: A rich French stew with tender beef braised in red wine, with a savory assortment of mushrooms, pearl onions, and bacon.
cooking_instructions:
Brown chunks of beef in hot oil and set aside.
In the same pan, cook bacon and set aside, leaving the fat.
Sauté onions, carrots, and garlic in the bacon fat.
Deglaze the pan with red wine, then return the beef and bacon to the pan.
Add beef stock and herbs, and simmer slowly until the beef is tender.
Serve with crusty bread or over mashed potatoes.

name: Roasted Vegetable Medley
description: A colorful and healthy assortment of roasted vegetables seasoned with herbs and olive oil.
cooking_instructions:
Chop a variety of vegetables, such as zucchini, peppers, carrots, and onions.
Toss with olive oil, salt, pepper, and your choice of herbs.
Spread the vegetables in a single layer on a baking sheet.
Roast in a preheated oven until they are tender and edges are caramelized.
Serve warm as a side dish or as a healthy main course.

name: Chicken Tikka Masala
description: A beloved Indian dish featuring grilled marinated chicken pieces smothered in a creamy, spiced tomato sauce.
cooking_instructions: Marinate chicken pieces in yogurt, lemon juice, and spices, then grill until cooked. For the sauce, sauté garlic and jalapeno, add spices, tomato sauce, and cream. Simmer until thickened. Add the grilled chicken to the sauce and cook for 10 minutes. Garnish with cilantro and serve with rice or naan.

name: Classic Caesar Salad
description: A timeless salad with crisp romaine lettuce, crunchy croutons, and a creamy Parmesan dressing.
cooking_instructions:
Toss chopped romaine lettuce with a homemade Caesar dressing.
Add croutons and grate fresh Parmesan cheese over the top.
For an authentic touch, sprinkle with anchovies.
Serve chilled, ideally as a starter or light main course.

name: Lemon Herb Grilled Salmon
description: Grilled salmon fillets marinated with a zesty lemon herb mixture for a light and flavorful seafood dish.
cooking_instructions:
Combine lemon zest, lemon juice, chopped dill, parsley, minced garlic, olive oil, salt, and pepper to create a marinade.
 Coat the salmon and let it marinate. Grill the salmon to desired doneness. Serve with extra lemon wedges and a sprinkle of fresh herbs.

name: Quinoa and Black Bean Salad
description: A hearty and nutritious salad with a Southwestern twist, featuring quinoa, black beans, and a variety of fresh vegetables.
cooking_instructions:
Cook quinoa according to package instructions and let it cool. Rinse and drain black beans. Dice the bell pepper and avocado. Chop cilantro. Whisk together lime juice, olive oil, cumin, chili powder, salt, and pepper to make the dressing.
 Toss all ingredients with the dressing and serve chilled or at room temperature.

name: Pan-Seared Duck Breast
description: A succulent duck breast with a crisp skin, served with a rich and aromatic orange sauce.
cooking_instructions:
Score the duck skin, season with salt and pepper, and sear on the skin side down until crisp. Flip and cook to desired doneness. For the sauce, caramelize sugar, deglaze with vinegar, add orange juice, zest, stock, and reduce.
 Finish with a splash of cognac and swirl in butter. Serve the sliced duck with the orange sauce.

name: Spinach and Ricotta Stuffed Shells
description: Jumbo pasta shells filled with creamy ricotta and spinach, baked in a savory tomato sauce.
cooking_instructions:
Boil large pasta shells until al dente.
Mix cooked spinach with ricotta, Parmesan, egg, salt, and pepper.
Stuff the mixture into the shells.
Place in a baking dish, cover with marinara sauce, and bake until bubbly.

name: Spicy Thai Basil Chicken
description: A stir-fry dish with ground chicken, Thai basil, and a flavorful sauce, served over jasmine rice.
cooking_instructions:
Sauté minced chicken in a hot pan with oil.
Add finely chopped garlic and fresh chilies to the mix.
Season with a splash of soy sauce and a dash of fish sauce for umami depth.
Once the chicken is cooked, toss in a generous handful of Thai basil leaves until they just wilt.
Serve the dish hot, accompanied by steamed jasmine rice for a complete meal.

name: Maple Glazed Carrots
description: Tender carrots glazed in a sweet and buttery maple syrup sauce, sprinkled with fresh herbs.
cooking_instructions:
Slice carrots into batons and place them on a baking sheet.
Drizzle with pure maple syrup and melted butter, tossing to coat evenly.
Season with salt, pepper, and a touch of cinnamon for warmth.
Roast in a preheated oven until they are fork-tender and the edges are caramelized.
Garnish with a sprinkle of fresh parsley before serving.

name: Chocolate Lava Cake
description: A decadent dessert with a gooey chocolate center, perfect with a scoop of vanilla ice cream.
cooking_instructions:
Whisk together melted dark chocolate and butter.
Beat in eggs and sugar until pale, then fold in a sifted mixture of flour and cocoa powder.
Pour the batter into greased ramekins.
Bake just long enough so the edges are set but the center remains molten.
Serve immediately, with a dusting of powdered sugar or a scoop of vanilla ice cream on top.

name: Creamy Mushroom Risotto
description: A classic Italian risotto with earthy mushrooms and rich Parmesan cheese.
cooking_instructions:
Sauté chopped onions in butter until translucent.
Add arborio rice and toast for a few minutes, then deglaze with white wine.
Slowly add warm chicken or vegetable stock, one ladle at a time, stirring constantly.
When the risotto is almost done, stir in sautéed mushrooms and finish with grated Parmesan cheese and a knob of butter for richness.
Serve warm, garnished with a sprinkle of chopped parsley and additional Parmesan if desired.

name: Lamb Rogan Josh
description: Aromatic Kashmiri dish featuring tender pieces of lamb in a rich and spicy tomato sauce.
cooking_instructions:
Season lamb pieces with salt and let sit.
In a pot, heat oil and brown the lamb, then set aside.
In the same pot, fry a mixture of ground spices—cardamom, cloves, cinnamon, and paprika.
Add chopped onions and tomatoes, cooking until soft.
Return the lamb to the pot with yogurt and water.
Simmer until the lamb is tender and the sauce is rich.
Garnish with fresh coriander and serve with naan or rice.

name: Butternut Squash Soup
description: A smooth and creamy soup made with roasted butternut squash and a hint of nutmeg.
cooking_instructions:
Peel and cube butternut squash, and roast until soft.
In a pot, sauté onions, garlic, and ginger until fragrant.
Add the roasted squash, vegetable stock, and seasoning.
Simmer, then blend until smooth.
Stir in a touch of cream and adjust the seasoning.
Serve hot, garnished with a swirl of cream and roasted pumpkin seeds.

name: Fish and Chips
description: Crispy beer-battered fish served with golden fried chips, a British classic.
cooking_instructions:
Coat fish fillets in seasoned flour, then dip into a beer batter.
Deep-fry in hot oil until golden and crispy.
Serve with thick-cut chips, also fried until golden.
Accompany with tartar sauce and a wedge of lemon.

name: Pumpkin Pie
description: A sweet dessert pie with a spiced pumpkin-based custard filling in a flaky crust.
cooking_instructions:
Mix pumpkin puree with eggs, sugar, and a blend of spices—cinnamon, nutmeg, ginger, and cloves.
Pour into a pie crust and bake until the filling is set but still slightly wobbly in the center.
Cool completely and serve with a dollop of whipped cream.
